Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2012 04:35PM CindyLooWho wrote: Yes curveball, the treatment for DCIS is different. First on the HER2, they do the test as a standard now, but they don't know what it means for DCIS, only for invasive cancer. but they want the data for the future. Because I had stage zero DCIS and clear nodes and both spots were tiny with good margins (except the one I'm having revised from 2 ml to 5 on Monday) the MO said there is no value to tamoxifen because I have no breast tissue left in which to develop cancer. My BMX was, he said, ultimately the best treatment I could have ever asked for. Based on my pathology he says my odds are at much less than 1% and he can't improve that. He does want me to stop my nuvaring use in the next 6 months though. He said I need to eliminate the estrogen. I use it to help hormonal migraines. He advised waiting until I'm feeling better than stopping it and seeing how the migraines are. If they are bad then I need to talk to my PCP about preventive migraine drugs. He said I lucked out in my decision making process and made all the right choices...I am very thankful and understand how truly lucky I am. ‚ù§
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2012 06:42PM CindyLooWho wrote: Oh cat I understand the frustration. I'm sorry that this is happening. For all you know that DCIS was already there 10 months ago. I have had MRIs, ultra sound and mamms, no one saw anything in the left...but I knew it would happen again, I just knew it. When he told me the path showed a 1.5 mm spot....I wasn't surprised. He said it was so tiny it was like finding a needle in a haystack. You are correct there is no way to know they got all the breast tissue. I think if I had a larger area with smaller margins they might have suggested tamoxifen, but he said for me it isn't worth the potential side effects. Hang in there...hugs

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2012 07:50PM CindyLooWho wrote: After reading how bad it was for some I called the nurse nav and she walked me thru it. She said they studied their process and that of other facilities a few years back due to patient complaints about the pain. They now use numbing agent that is done an hour before injection, lidocaine which does burn, then the isotope. They use much smaller needles also. She said they have not had a complaint in 3 years. I asked if I could take a Xanax before and she said...if you got'em, take'em! Still really scared about something injected into my nipple....I cringe thinking about it. My cousin said she barely remembers it, didn't hurt at all. I hope we are all that lucky.

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2012 08:50PM CindyLooWho wrote: That's what I was afraid of. I read to take your pain meds an hour before because they yank them out. So they don't numb it or anything first? Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2012 01:28PM CindyLooWho wrote: Soteria I have no appetite either and taking the same antibiotic. If I don't take it with food I get lightheaded and woogy. I'm eating cuz I know I need to. I have two drains with my BMX and I was told when output is less than 30 mls in 24 hours they can come out. I still need the pain meds but I'm able to go 6 hours now. My drains are awful. The surgeons PA said its because i don't have much body fat, so they are right under the skin. Yesterday was awful. I am also getting the spasms and vibrating. Worse in the morning, I have a feeling that fills are not going to be fun for me. My skin seems to have lots of feeling...so far. They are saying several days without power. Ugh so glad we have a generator. I live hearing everyone's updates. Hugs to you all.

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2012 08:22PM CindyLooWho wrote: Dulci I feel the same way. I was in Walmart getting the gauze and aquafor and all that other stuff and I wanted to yell can you all just stop for second because I have cancer. Got my camisoles too. Another site embracingmastectomy.com ...she said get a package of men's or boy's cheap white cotton tank undershirts. She said after the bandages are off she would put on the aquafor or whatever and one of the shirts under the cami or her button down pajama tops. Said it was comfy and then any oozy things stay on the shirt. I got a package of 8 for $10. Got the stool softener, lots of my coconut water for hydration...trying to have everything on hand that everyone suggested, I want to be ready for anything. I can donate what I don't use. I'm back from trip Wednesday night then two more days at work, then clean the house pay the bills and get organized. I already warned my husband... My friends are all offering to cook, so I am letting them. Its hard for me to take help, but the DH needs to eat. I told them lots of protein and fruits and veggies. I think the only things I need is a genie bra and zip front sports bra. Focusing on the prep helps me forget about the why I need to prep...

Hope you girls did well today. I will be thinking about you all. Hugs Group hug Connie!

Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2012 12:24PM CindyLooWho wrote: Hi Junebug...I was telling my husband this morning that it all still seems so unreal and unfair. I guess when I get to my hospital room on Tuesday the reality will smack me in the face. I feel the same way about "Pinktober". And it is super annoying that everyone just assumes you support it. Well I don't. I think it's great for some people but not me. I'm not being defined by a disease and I feel like I need to deal with it my own way and shoving it in my face is not helping. And if I hear one more commercial touting all the things you can do to prevent BC...all things that I have done my whole life and look where it got me....I will kill someone!!! Yup I'm bitter....it's bad and I know I have to get over it, I know it....I just can't right now.
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2012 05:54AM CindyLooWho wrote: I asked people not to share. I feel like its not theirs to share, but you have to tell them anyway. My issue is I don't want people staring at my chest wondering what I did. And if everyone knows then you can't be normal anywhere. You always have to be the girl with BC. Sometimes I just want to NOT talk about it.
